summary:
Okay, so has any noticed that it very very much seems like Miles has a major anxiety disorder? 
Besides the whole having trouble...
body:
Okay, so has any noticed that it very very much seems like Miles has a major anxiety disorder?

Besides the whole having trouble socializing with people. We can see this by his method of hiding his new abilities. Instead of trying to keep cool, he ducks and runs around the school like as if the whole school knows about his problem. How he talk to Gwen and how quickly his mind is racing when having a normal conversation with her.

Not only that but he also covers his face when his dad was driving past a couple of people from school. He didn’t have to but it seems like he thinks the worst of things first. He also thinks so down at himself. When people in his old school said that they missed him which was something he didn’t expect. He didn’t think that people would actually miss seeing him or even think of him.

And to top it off miles’ anxiety even controls his powers. When feeling any way anxious he turns invisible. Not just in a fight or flight moments, because when he became overwhelmed with the different spidermans trying to teach him. He turned invisible to run away from the situation.

Miles’ parents are even aware with his anxiety. When he runs back home to sleep there for the night. You can hear his mother’s talking about that he can be a bit “sensitive”. They know that miles keeps somethings inside and has problems with expressing his feelings. This leaving a gap between his father and himself.

And last, we can see that miles has major difficulty handling his emotions by myself and gets very overwhelmed very quickly. He doesn’t really have a coping method to calm himself down. He tried to call his uncle when feeling stressed or overwhelmed. He goes to his parents house aswell. He had to learn a coping method (which was music) when trying unstick himself because he didn’t know how to calm himself down.

Pretty much. Miles is a precious anxious boy that needs to be protected.

tags: some of yall really just need a nap
summary: Look, I'm annoyed by certain MCU stans acting high and mighty while presenting misinformation too but uh...y'all know we ain't...
body: Look, I’m annoyed by certain MCU stans acting high and mighty while presenting misinformation too but uh…y'all know we ain’t gotta jump down the throat of every person who’s genuinely interested in learning more about Miles/Jeff and Rio/adult Peter/the comic Spider-Verse right? Like yeah, some things are big “no duh” moments for us and can be quickly googled to avoid embarassment…but being unnecessarily vicious on people’s headcanon posts because they got a piece of information wrong while they were excited (not everyone deep dives comics the way high-volume readers do) is not the wave and shouldn’t be considered so moving forward.

summary: Uhhhh... are we going to pretend Doc Ock, even beyond being a villain that would kill five thousand people just to show he can,...
body: Uhhhh… are we going to pretend Doc Ock, even beyond being a villain that would kill five thousand people just to show he can, and all of New York to get rid of one guy he wouldn’t even have to face if he abandoned crime, didn’t always go to Aunt May to take advantage of her, either to kidnap her, use her house as an undercover HQ or marry her to get joint (at the very least, he might have killed her for full) ownership of the nuclear base she inherited? And we’re going to ignore how, even when his reasons for reaching out to her weren’t outright villainous and evil, they were still about taking advantage of the kindness and affection of a woman who didn’t know about all the things he’d done or planned to do, and who was endangered by his very presence either because he’s probably going to do commit some crime (because that’s who he is), because some law enforcer/super-hero might find him and try to have him jailed and he won’t give himself up (because that’s who he is) or because he literally went to her to escape/hide from something or someone dangerous? And we’re going to go “awwww, maybe no one’s a villain on Christmas Eve :’(”?

reblog.comment: Uhhhh… are we going to pretend Doc Ock, even beyond being a villain that would kill five thousand people just to show he can, and all of New York to get rid of one guy he wouldn’t even have to face if he abandoned crime, didn’t always go to Aunt May to take advantage of her, either to kidnap her, use her house as an undercover HQ or marry her to get joint (at the very least, he might have killed her for full) ownership of the nuclear base she inherited? And we’re going to go “awwww, maybe no one’s a villain on Christmas Eve :’(”?

And we’re going to ignore how, even when his reasons for reaching out to her weren’t outright villainous and evil, they were still about taking advantage of the kindness and affection of a woman who didn’t know about all the things he’d done or planned to do, and who was endangered by his very presence either because he’s probably going to do commit some crime (because that’s who he is), because some law enforcer/super-hero might find him and try to have him jailed and he won’t give himself up (because that’s who he is) or because he literally went to her to escape/hide from something or someone dangerous? And we’re going to go “awwww, maybe no one’s a villain on Christmas Eve :’(”?

And we’re going to ignore how, even when his reasons for reaching out to her weren’t outright villainous and evil, they were still about taking advantage of the kindness and affection of a woman who didn’t know about all the things he’d done or planned to do, and who was endangered by his very presence either because he’s probably going to do commit some crime (because that’s who he is), because some law enforcer/super-hero might find him and try to have him jailed and he won’t give himself up (because that’s who he is) or because he literally went to her to escape/hide from something or someone dangerous? And we’re going to go “awwww, maybe no one’s a villain on Christmas Eve :’(”?

body:
Spider-Man (PS4)

I received Spider-Man along a Playstation 4 Pro and instead of playing it immediately, I hesitated. I was afraid it wouldn’t be as good as I expected it to be. Well, yesterday I played it for a while AND IT’S AWESOME.

I recently activated again my World of Warcraft subscription and it seems I won’t be playing it that much…

tags: spider man into the spider verse
summary:
A little spoiler if you haven’t seen Spider-Man Into the Spider Verse.
There’s two moments in the spider cave where Miles is...
body:
A little spoiler if you haven’t seen Spider-Man Into the Spider Verse.

There’s two moments in the spider cave where Miles is looking at Spider-Man’s suit. The first where his reflection of his eyes doesn’t reach the eyes of the suit and then the second where his reflection does reach.

Like the symbolism of how he doesn’t see himself as Spider-Man yet and then when he’s finally ready to take on the mantle.

reblog.comment:

summary:
Guess who made a spidersona :3c
She’s a stealthy babe who makes intricately designed webs to trap baddies
Her hip poofs are a...
body:
Guess who made a spidersona :3c

She’s a stealthy babe who makes intricately designed webs to trap baddies

Her hip poofs are a web mesh she can extend for gliding, shielding, or cloaking to go invisible

summary: “Okay, the good news is that I’ve got a lot more room to maneuver out here. The bad news is-- I’m too stupid to maneuver to my...
caption:
“Okay, the good news is that I’ve got a lot more room to maneuver out here. The bad news is–

I’m too stupid to maneuver to my nice safe apartment and hide under the bed!”

Web of Spider-Man #74

The whole of his fight against Spark was pure gold, and I was thinking of just making a post about Peter vs. Performance Art. They might have made him more of a jerk than usual in this issue, but the comedy was worth it.

reblog.comment:
“Okay, the good news is that I’ve got a lot more room to maneuver out here. The bad news is–

I’m too stupid to maneuver to my nice safe apartment and hide under the bed!”

trail.content:
“Okay, the good news is that I’ve got a lot more room to maneuver out here. The bad news is–

I’m too stupid to maneuver to my nice safe apartment and hide under the bed!”

Web of Spider-Man #74

The whole of his fight against Spark was pure gold, and I was thinking of just making a post about Peter vs. Performance Art. They might have made him more of a jerk than usual in this issue, but the comedy was worth it.
